ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] JMX password file is missing or permissions      not set correctly
ygData.msgSnippet: Hi, I noticed on Windows Server 2003 that the owner of my files wsa set to the group Administrators instead of my own user. Java will then caugh on the JMX

From: "Maximilian Schoefmann" <schoefma@...>
Subject: Re: [archive-crawler] JMX password file is missing or permissions 
     not set correctly
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=284768837

Hi,

I noticed on Windows Server 2003 that the owner of my files wsa set to the
group "Administrators" instead of my own user. Java will then caugh on the
JMX passwords file, even if the permissions were fixed. For a solution,
see:

http://www.cip.ifi.lmu.de/~schoefma/howto/run_heritrix_on_windows/#trouble

There is unfortunately no command line trick (on a default Windows
installation) to set the ownership of a file from the script.

HTH,
Max
